Detailed Description

Convenience Functions supporting Daisybase for ASC500.

Defines functions that simplify the use of the daisybase library for the control of the ASC500 SPM controller. The functions are not part of the daisybase lib; the source code may be included in application projects. These functions must not be called from the context of a daisybase callback function.

Definition in file asc500helpers.h.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* ASC500_BufferCallback)(Int32 channel, ASC500_bufferStatus status)

Frame Callback Function.

Functions of this type can be registered as callback functions for frame data. They will be called by the event loop as soon as one of the following conditions occur: Received data is exeeding the given maximum buffer length, a timeout while receiving data occurs, an index of 0 in the received data stream appears for a second time (indicating data belong to a new frame).

Parameters:
channel Data channel that has sent the data
status Reason for calling function

Definition at line 62 of file asc500helpers.h.

typedef void(* ASC500_PathCallback)(void)

Path Callback Function.

Functions of this type can be registered as callback functions for path mode. They will be called by the event loop as soon as the scanner reached a destination position on the given path.

Definition at line 72 of file asc500helpers.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ASC500_bufferStatus

status codes of the frame callback functions

Enumerator:
ASC500_frameTimeout 

Reason of callback is timeout.

ASC500_frameLength 

Reason of callback is reached length.

ASC500_frameIndex 

Reason of callback is index of zero.

Function Documentation

DYB_Rc ASC500_configureChannel ( Int32  number,
Int32  trigger,
Int32  source,
Bln32  average,
float  smpTime 
)

Configure a Channel.

Configures what kind of data is sent on a specific data channel.

Parameters:
number Number of the channel to be configured
trigger Trigger source for data output
source Data source for the channel
average If the controller should average data over the sample time (boolean)
smpTime Time per sample in [s]. Has no effect unless the trigger parameter is "timer based".
Returns:
DYB_Ok - Success
DYB_OutOfRange - Invalid channel number
DYB_ServerLost - Can't send - server not running?

Bln32  set 
)

Activate Outputs.

Sets and retreives the activation state of electric outputs. It encapsulates the explicitly asynchronous activation protocol and may therefore take up to a second.

Parameters:
state In/Out: Activate outputs (bool)
set 1: Send the supplied values to the controller 0: Ignore input; only retreive the results
Returns:

float *  y,
Bln32  set

Control Scanner Offset.

Sets and retreives the offset point of the scan range. The parameters are used for input of the demanded value and for output of the value actually achieved.

y In/Out: y component [m].
set 1: Send the supplied values to the controller 0: Ignore input; only retreive the results
Returns:
see DYB_setParameterSync()

Returns:

DYB_Rc ASC500_setFrameBuffer ( Int32  channel,
const Int32 *  buffer,
const DYB_Meta *  meta,
Int32  maxLength 
)

Set Frame Buffer.

Sets the frame buffer and callback conditions for the channel

Parameters:
channel Number of the data channel. Numbers begin with 0, the maximum is product specifc.
buffer Pointer to the data buffer
meta Pointer to the corresponding meta data
maxLength Maximum count of data words the buffer can hold
Returns:
see DYB_setParameterSync
DYB_Rc ASC500_setFrameCallback ( Int32  channel,
ASC500_BufferCallback  callback 
)

Register Frame Callback Function.

Registers a callback function for a data channel associated to the scanner. That function will be called when a condition occurs, defined in ASC500_setFrameBuffer. A callback function registered previously is unregistered.

The function is called in the context of a thread that serves the event loop. If it is not processed fast enough, events or data may be lost.

Parameters:
channel Number of the data channel. Numbers begin with 0, the maximum is product specifc.
callback Callback function for that channel, use NULL to unregister a function
Returns:
DYB_Ok - Successful
DYB_ServerLost - Data request failed - server not running?
